snippet: The rich are flown in on private planes, then picked up at the Burning Man airport, driven to their camp and served like kings and queens for a week.
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column observes that Burning Man, arts festival in Nevada desert that was once domain of those with countercultural bent, has over last two years become annual getaway for new crop of wealthy technology moguls; some say new rich are creating sense of separation and ruining festival for everyone else.
lead_paragraph: The rich are flown in on private planes, then picked up at the Burning Man airport, driven to their camp and served like kings and queens for a week.

headline.print_headline: A Line Is Drawn in the Desert
headline.seo: At Burning Man, the Tech Elite One-Up One Another
headline.main: A Line Is Drawn in the Desert
